recital.text: The Stockbridge-Munsee Community is a federally recognized Indian tribe with inherent sovereign powers and is governed by the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council pursuant to the 1937 Constitution, as amended;
The Stockbridge-Munsee Community has the authority under its Constitution and its inherent rights as a sovereign nation to adopt ordinances;

The Stockbridge-Munsee Community recognizes the negative impacts that substance abuse and addiction issues have on the community and wishes to provide additional ways to help individuals with these issues find a path back to being a healthy and productive member of the community;

The establishment of a Healing to Wellness Court would provide an option for diversion of legal offenders with substance abuse and addiction issues away from the regular court system and toward a more holistic, healing approach that involves a treatment-oriented perspective;

The Tribal Council wishes to establish a Healing to Wellness Court as part of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Court system through the adoption of the Healing to Wellness Court Ordinance, Chapter TCT.06;
that the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council hereby adopts Chapter TCT.06, Healing to Wellness Court Ordinance, and authorizes its submittal to the U.S. Bureau of Indian Affairs for approval.

procedural-data.text: I, the undersigned, as Secretary of the Stockbridge-Munsee Tribal Council, hereby certify that the Council is composed of 7 members, of whom 6, constituting a quorum, were present at a meeting duly called, noticed, and held on the 18th day of January, 2022, that the foregoing resolution was duly adopted at such meeting by a vote of 5 for, 0 against, and 0 abstaining.
Shannon Holsey, President Jody Hartwig, Secretary
